alert.note: Alert for Mineral (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 06 at 9:15AM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Walker River Near Schurz affecting Mineral County. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases are causing high river flows. Minor flooding downstream from Weber Dam is ongoing. Some low lying and agricultural areas below Weber are flooded, including some rural access roads. There are reports of stranded cattle on higher islands within the river channel. Severe bank erosion is ongoing, with a large amount of debris in the river channel, so use extreme caution along the riverbanks. For the Mainstem Walker River...including Schurz...elevated river levels are ongoing and expected to be prolonged. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt and reservoir releases. * WHERE...Walker River Near Schurz. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.7 feet, Major flooding from Weber Dam to Walker Lake, including Schurz. Roads, bridges and lowest structures in Schurz area flood. Minor Lowland and agricultural flooding, along with rural road flooding. More significant impacts will be possible if upstream releases are increased to help with reservoir control and storage as the record snow pack continues to melt. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:40 AM PDT Tuesday the stage was 7.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:40 AM PDT Tuesday was 7.2 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood stage is 5.9 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks or tending fields and livestock. Additional information is available at www.cnrfc.noaa.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon.
